pull.title: net: flag relevant Sock methods with [[nodiscard]]
pull.body: Flag relevant Sock methods with `[[nodiscard]]` to avoid issues like the one fixed in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21631.

events.body:
[Having two `Wait()` methods](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21631#issuecomment-816748448) - one flagged with `[[nodiscard]]` with 3 arguments and one without `[[nodiscard]]` with 2 arguments seems like too much new lines of code.

I am ~0 on this. Taking the dump/KISS approach for now - one `[[nodiscard]] Wait()` and cast to `void` the callers that don't check the return value.

cc @practicalswift

Concept ACK

Rationale: Having the `[[nodiscard]]` annotation on `Wait` would have saved us from one uninitialized read historically. That's enough empirical evidence to convince me about the need for `[[nodiscard]]` here.

Thanks for addressing this!
